alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 11:19AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. .River basins remain elevated with recent snowmelt. The river is expected to slowly drop in level over the next few days. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko, Test - Elko, Carlin... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river flows caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River Near Elko. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Action Stage - Near bankfull conditions. Isolated minor lowland flooding possible upstream and downstream of Elko. No flooding expected in Elko. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:25 AM PDT Sunday, June 03 the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.6 feet Saturday, June 03. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.2 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday at 1200 PM PDT.
